S3-10: Housekeeping or Diagnostic Structure Report (3,10) or (3,12)
S3-25: Periodic Housekeeping or Diagnostic Report (3,25) or (3,26)
S3-25s: One-Shot Housekeeping or Diagnostic Report (response to command (3,27) or (3,28))
S5-8: List of Disabled Event Identifiers Report (5,8)

S1-A: Parameter values are as defined by the service 1 procedures called in adaptation points S1-1 to S1-9
S3-10: The definition of a SID in the RDL with the layout defined in clauses 8.3.2.10 and 8.3.2.12 of [PS-SP]
S3-25: The values of the data items associated to the report's SID in the RDL with the layout defined in clauses 8.3.2.25 and 8.3.2.26 of [PS-SP]
S3-25s: The values of the data items associated to the report's SID in the RDL with the layout defined in clauses 8.3.2.25 and 8.3.2.26 of [PS-SP]
S5-8: The list of disabled event identifiers with the layout defined in clauses 8.5.2.8 of [PS-SP]

S1-A: No discriminant attribute is defined for service 1 success reports. For failure reports, the failure code acts as discriminant.
S3-10: The Structure Identifier (SID) of the report
S3-25: The Structure Identifier (SID) of the report
S3-25s: The Structure Identifier (SID) of the report

S1-A: The destination of service 1 reports is set equal to the source of the command being verified
S3-10: The destination is set equal to the source of the (3,9) or (3,11) command which triggered the report
S3-25: The destination is read from the \texttt{dest} field of the Report Definition corresponding to the report's SID
S3-25s: The destination is read from the \texttt{dest} field of the Report Definition corresponding to the report's SID
S5-8: The destination is set equal to the source of the (3,7) command which triggered the report
S17-2: The destination is set equal to the source of the (17,1) command which triggers the (17,2)
S17-4: The destination is set equal to the source of the (17,3) command which triggers the (17,4)

S1-A: Service 1 reports retrieve their enable status from the OurRegistry as a function of their type, sub-type and discriminant
S3-10: The enable status is read from the \texttt{isEnabled} field of the Report Definition corresponding to the report's SID
S3-25: The enable status is read from the \texttt{isEnabled} field of the Report Definition corresponding to the report's SID
S5-1: Update service 5 observable nOfDetectedEvt\_x ('x' is the event severity level) and then retrieve the enable status from the OurRegistry as a function of the report type, sub-type and discriminant

S3-25: Run the procedure Ready Check of HkRep Report of figure \ref{fig:Rep3s25Ready}

S3-10: Load the SID definition from the RDL
S3-25: Load the value of the simply-commutated data items from the data pool and that of the super-commutated data items from the Sampling Buffer associated to the report's SID according to the Report Definition
S3-25s: Load the value of the simply-commutated data items from the data pool and that of the super-commutated data items from the Sampling Buffer associated to the report's SID according to the Report Definition
S5-1: Update service 5 observables: nOfGenEvtRep\_x, lastEvtEid\_i, lastEvtTime\_x ('x' is the event severity level). Note that the parameter values are set by the application which creates the event report at the time it creates the event report.
S5-8: Load the list of disabled event identifiers from arrays isEidEnabled1 to isEidEnabled4
